GHOST_FUTURE.name: Ghost of Christmas Yet to Come

SCROOGE.desc: An old miser. Cold, solitary, universally disliked. Partner in Scrooge and Marley.
An old miser warned by Marley's ghost that three spirits will visit — his only chance to escape an eternity in chains.
An old miser who was once a lonely, neglected boy, then a happy apprentice, then a young man who lost the woman he loved to greed.

A miser beginning to see the cost of his ways. Once a lonely boy, a happy apprentice, a man who lost love to greed. Now confronted with the poverty of his clerk's family — told a child may die because of men like him.
A miser who has seen the full arc: lonely boy, lost love, a dying child, an unmourned death, and his own neglected grave. Has vowed to change.
Once a cold miser, now transformed. Generous, joyful. Was a lonely boy, a happy apprentice, lost love to greed, saw the darkest future — and chose differently.

MARLEY.desc: Scrooge's deceased business partner. Dead seven years.
Scrooge's dead partner. Appeared as a ghost bound in chains forged by a lifetime of greed. Warned Scrooge of three spirits — his only chance.

BOB.desc: Scrooge's clerk. Poorly paid, works in freezing conditions.
Scrooge's underpaid clerk. A devoted father who carries his disabled son on his shoulder. Makes the best of very little.
Scrooge's underpaid clerk. Devoted father to Tiny Tim. Loyal enough to toast Scrooge even on Christmas Day. The spirit has warned that Tim may die.
Scrooge's clerk. A devoted father. In a future vision, Tiny Tim has died and the family mourns.
Scrooge's clerk, now with a raised salary and a promise of help. A devoted father whose loyalty was finally repaid.

TINY_TIM.desc: Bob's youngest son. Small, disabled, walks with a crutch. Sweet and brave.
Bob's youngest son. Disabled, walks with a crutch. The spirit has warned he will die unless things change.
Bob's youngest son. Disabled. The spirit warned he would die — and in the future vision, he has.
Bob's youngest son. Alive and well — the dark future averted. Scrooge has become a second father to him.

MRS_CRATCHIT.desc: Bob's wife. Resourceful and proud. Creates a festive Christmas from almost nothing.
Bob's wife. Resourceful, proud, openly resentful of Scrooge for how little he pays Bob.
Bob's wife. Resourceful and proud. Resentful of Scrooge. In the future vision, mourning Tiny Tim.

FRED.desc: Scrooge's nephew. Son of Scrooge's late sister Fan. Warm, cheerful, refuses to give up on his uncle.
Scrooge's nephew. Son of Fan. Warm and persistent — defends Scrooge even when his guests mock the old man.
Scrooge's nephew. Warm and persistent. Son of Fan. Finally rewarded when Scrooge arrives at his party.

FRED_WIFE.desc: Fred's wife. Pretty, with a dimpled face. Good-humoured.

GHOST_PAST.desc: The first spirit. Both child and elder. Wears white, emits light from its head. Shows visions of the past.
The first spirit. Showed Scrooge his lonely boyhood, Fezziwig's warmth, and Belle's departure. Extinguished by Scrooge.

GHOST_PRESENT.desc: The second spirit. A giant in a green robe with a holly wreath. Jolly, generous. Shows the world as it is now.
The second spirit. Showed the Cratchits, Fred's party, and Christmas across Britain. Aged in a single night. Hid Ignorance and Want beneath its robe.

GHOST_FUTURE.desc: The third spirit. A silent black phantom. Communicates only by pointing. Shows the future.
The third spirit. Showed an unmourned death, thieves, Tiny Tim's death, and Scrooge's own neglected grave.

CHARITY.desc: Two gentlemen collecting for the poor at Christmas. Scrooge turned them away.
Collectors for the poor. Scrooge turned them away on Christmas Eve, then gave an enormous donation on Christmas Day.

FAN.desc: Scrooge's younger sister. Small and loving. Rescued him from the lonely school. Died young — Fred is her son.

FEZZIWIG.desc: Scrooge's old employer. Jolly, generous. Hosted a magnificent Christmas ball. A model of what a good master looks like.

MRS_FEZZIWIG.desc: Fezziwig's wife. Broad, beaming, dances energetically.

DICK.desc: Scrooge's fellow apprentice at Fezziwig's. Scrooge was fond of him.

BELLE.desc: Scrooge's former fiancée. Broke off the engagement when greed displaced her. Later seen happily married with children.

BELLE_HUSBAND.desc: Belle's husband. Mentioned seeing old Scrooge alone at his desk while Marley lay dying.

YOUNG_SCROOGE.desc: Scrooge as a boy. Left alone at school during Christmas. Finds comfort in storybooks.
Scrooge from boy to apprentice. Lonely child, then eager and full of life at Fezziwig's.
Scrooge from boyhood to young manhood. Lonely child, happy apprentice, then a man whose heart turned to gold. Belle saw the change before he did.

MARTHA.desc: Eldest Cratchit daughter. Works at a milliner's. Arrives late for Christmas dinner.

PETER.desc: A Cratchit son. Wears Bob's enormous hand-me-down shirt collar with pride.
A Cratchit son. In the future vision, reads to the family as they mourn Tiny Tim.

BELINDA.desc: Second Cratchit daughter. Helps with the Christmas dinner.

IGN_WANT.desc: Two starving children beneath the Spirit's robe. The boy is Ignorance; the girl is Want. 'Beware them both.'

OLD_JOE.desc: A disreputable fence. Buys stolen goods from a dead man's household.

MRS_DILBER.desc: A laundress who stole from the dead man's room.
